Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/19/2024, a youth stepped outside onto the porch to try to
de-escalate. The staff at the facility would not let the youth back
in, leaving the youth locked outside for 45 minutes. Youth was not
appropriately dressed to include lack of shoes. Youth was taken to
the hospital for cold exposure and possibly having hypothermia.
Investigation Phone calls to Complainant were made December 20, 2024,
and December 26, 2024. There was no way to leave a message
for Complainant and I would have to continue to call to try and
speak with Complainant. I was informed Complainant’s hours
vary but mainly Complainant works third shift.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
described being upset and going outside on the porch to “take
five” because that is Youth A’s identified safe spot. Youth A
stated, “they locked me out.” Youth A reported Youth B tried to let
Youth A back into the house, but Staff 1 and Staff 4 told Youth B
not to let Youth A in the house. Youth A denied any staff or youth
checked on Youth A when Youth A was standing on the porch.
Youth A stated she was pounding on the door to come in and was
only wearing a short sleeve shirt and pants. Youth A reported she
ran off the porch and into the woods. Youth A stated
approximately 20 minutes later she was located by Staff 5 and
taken to the hospital. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 3 and Staff 4
were working when Youth A went out on the porch. Youth A again
denied any of the staff checked on her by opening the door or
looking out the window by the door.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
described Youth A being escalated and asking staff to “take five”
on the porch. Youth B reported a staff, could not recall who, told
Youth A not to go outside but Youth A did not listen and went onto
2

the porch. Youth B stated Youth A was banging on the door,
wanting to come back into the house but Staff 1 said Youth A
could not come back into the house because Youth A needed to
take more than a two-minute break. Youth B reported there were
two other staff working but Youth B could not recall who the staff
were. Youth B stated Staff 3 was the only staff who checked on
Youth A when Youth A was on the porch. Youth B reported Youth
A did not have a coat or shoes on when going outside to stand on
the porch.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
described Youth A “taking five in her safe space” because Youth A
was upset. Youth C could not recall the names of any of the staff
working the night of the incident with Youth A. Youth C reported
a staff member told Youth A not to go outside because it was too
cold, but Youth A still went outside and stood on the porch. Youth
C stated Youth A was only wearing a shirt, sweatpants and socks.
Youth C described Youth A wanting to come back inside and staff
said no. Youth C stated about “30 seconds later” staff opened the
door and said Youth A’s name multiple times and that is when
Youth A was determined to be gone.
Youth C reported Staff 4 yelled and swore at Youth A in the past
when Youth A put marshmallow fluffy on Staff 4’s shoes. Youth C
could not recall when this occurred but believed Staff 2 was
working at the time of the incident. Youth C denied Staff 4 yelling
or swearing at Youth C or any other youth.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D
described Youth A asking to “take five” on the porch, which Youth
D stated is Youth A’s safe spot. Youth D reported Staff 1, Staff 3,
and Staff 4 were working during this incident. Youth D reported
staff, could not recall who, checked on Youth A about 40 seconds
later and Youth A was gone. Youth D stated she did not think
Youth A knocked to come back into the house, or if Youth A did
knock, Youth D reported she did not hear it. Youth D denied
hearing any staff say not to let Youth A back into the house.
Youth D stated Youth B said not to let Youth A back into the
house. Youth D described Youth A going outside wearing a coat
but no shoes.
Youth D reported there was an incident where Youth A was
yelling, swearing, hitting and ended up destroying Staff 4’s shoes.
Youth D described Staff 4 yelling back at Youth A then walking
3

away into the staff office. Youth D denied hearing Staff 4 swear at
Youth A only yell at Youth A to stop how Youth A was behaving.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was upset and yelling about having to complete
household chores. Staff 1 stated Youth A said she needed to take
five and went outside on the porch as the porch is Youth A’s safe
space. Staff 1 reported she walked over to the window shortly
after Youth A went outside and checked on Youth A. Staff 1
stated she could see Youth A standing on the porch, so Staff 1 did
not go outside to check on Youth A. Staff 1 described Youth A
asking to be let in and Staff 4 said, “she needs to take a full five.”
Staff 1 denied hearing any staff say do not let her [Youth A] in.
Staff 1 reported she went to let Youth A inside and Youth A was
not on the porch. Staff 1 stated Youth A was wearing pants, shirt,
coat and slippers when she went outside.
Staff 1 denied any of the youth bringing concerns to Staff 1
regarding Staff 4 yelling or swearing. Staff 1 stated the night of
Youth A leaving the porch was the first night working with Staff 4.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 2, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist reported Youth A described to Therapist requesting to
go outside to take five, wanting to come back into the house and
Staff 4 yelled to the other staff not to let Youth A back into the
house because it had not been a full five minutes. Therapist
denied Youth A ever mentioning concerns regarding Staff 4 yelling
or swearing at Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth A getting upset from staff telling her “No” for something
Youth A was asking for, so Youth A got upset, put marshmallow
fluff on Staff 4’s shoes and started to argue with Staff 4. Staff 2
stated Staff 4 was arguing back and at the “same level” as Youth
A, so Staff 2 stepped in-between Youth A and Staff 4. Staff 2
denied hearing Staff 4 ever swear at Youth A or any youth. Staff 2
reported Staff 4 was getting loud and further escalating Youth A
but not saying anything inappropriate to Youth A. Staff 2
described Staff 4 walking away and the situation de-escalating.
Staff 2 stated, “staff are trained to keep their cool, not to yell back
at the youth.” Staff 2 denied any youth reporting concerns about
Staff 4 to Staff 2.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
Youth A stating she was going to “take five” on the porch. Staff 3
reported she asked Youth A to stay inside because it was so cold
outside, but Youth A said no, she wanted to go to her safe spot.
Staff 3 stated Youth A was wearing a Christmas sweater,
leggings, slippers but could not recall if Youth A had a coat on
when she went outside. Staff 3 reported Youth A knocked on the
door to come inside and Staff 4 said, she [Youth A] has not taken
a long enough five. Staff 3 described Staff 1 opening the door to
check on Youth A and discovered Youth A was no longer on the
porch.
Staff 3 stated Staff 4 escalated Youth A the night Youth A went on
the porch. Staff 3 described Staff 4 telling Youth A to “fold your
damn laundry” and flipping over Youth A’s laundry basket. Staff 3
denied ever hearing or seeing Staff 4 act this way toward Youth A
or any youth prior to this event. Staff 3 stated staff are not trained
to talk that way toward youth, that staff should not engage, nor
swear at youth and step away if needed.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described
Youth A being escalated and saying she was going to take five.
Staff 4 reported Youth A went outside on the porch, Youth A’s
safe spot, wearing a coat and slippers. Staff 4 stated Staff 1
checked on Youth A through the window about one minute after
Youth A went outside and approximately another minute later
opened the door to check on Youth A. Staff 4 described after
about three minutes of Youth A being outside Youth A requested
to come inside. Staff 4 stated it was not a proper five, meaning it
was not the full five minutes. Staff 4 stated in the past when
Youth A takes her full five minutes it really helps calm Youth A
down. Staff 4 reported she wanted Youth A to take the full five to
calm down and be able to come back into the house deescalated.
Staff 4 reported she had no indication Youth A was going to run
away and did not even think Youth A would run. Staff 4 stated if
she could go back, she would handle it differently.
Staff 4 reported “going back and forth” with Youth A over Youth
A’s house jobs and admitted to knocking over Youth A’s laundry
basket out of frustration. Staff 4 denied ever swearing at Youth A
but stated her voice was raised. Staff 4 stated when the incident
with the marshmallow fluff occurred Staff 2 did step in-between
Staff 4 and Youth A, but it was more to do with how Youth A was
5

acting. Staff 4 again denied ever swearing at Youth A or any
youth.
Video Review
Video footage of 12/19/24 inside Sherk House was reviewed on
01/02/25 with DHHS Worker. Video shows Youth A wearing a
long coat and slippers walking toward the back door of Sherk
House. Youth A stops, appears to talk with Staff 3 (there is no
sound on the video), then walks out the door stepping onto the
back porch of Sherk House at approximately 6:36pm. Staff 1 is
seen walking over toward the door and looking out the window.
There is a large window next to the door looking at the back
porch. Youth B walks over to the window and is observed looking
out the window. At approximately 6:37pm Staff 1 and Youth B
walk away from the window. At approximately 6:38pm Staff 1
walks to the door, opens the door, walks onto the porch then
enters back into the house closing the door. At approximately
6:39pm Staff 3 and Staff 4 walk to the door, open the door and go
onto the porch. At approximately 6:42pm Staff 4 enters Sherk
House alone. It is believed during this check Staff 3 and Staff 4
discover Youth A is no longer on the porch.
Documents Reviewed:
• Corewell Health Reed City Hospital report dated 12/19/24
for Youth A. Report indicates, “No findings that would
suggest frostbite.”
• Incident reports dated 12/19/24 regarding Youth A
completed by Staff 3 and Staff 4. Incident reports are
consistent with Youth A asking to take a five, going outside,
knocking to come back inside and Staff 4 saying she [Youth
A] needed to take a full five.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There were two disciplinary action
forms in Staff 1’s file not related to interactions with youth.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There were no discipline records in
Staff 4’s file.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy outlines
staff will treat residents and coworkers with respect and
dignity in words and action. All staff will strive to be
professional in the behavior, conversation and all
interactions with others.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
interviews as well as reviewing the incident reports, Staff 4 did not
allow Youth A back into the house and directed Staff 1 and Staff 3
to have Youth A take the full five minutes outside on the porch.
The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
6

interviews Staff 4 verbally engaged in matching Youth A’s
escalation and knocked over Youth A’s laundry basket in
frustration with Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was discussed finding a safe space for
Youth A inside the home during the colder months. It was also
discussed having staff understand how a decision to not allow a
youth inside because a full five-minute break did not occur, could
have led to serious safety concerns for Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C00000451 dated 6/28/23; CAP approval date 06/28/23
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth was AWOL and facility failed to notify appropriate parties.
Investigation Vice President of Treatment Programs was interviewed face
to face at the facility on January 2, 2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Vice President of Treatment Programs stated
administration staff were still on campus from the Village
Christmas night, and everyone started searching for Youth A once
being alerted Youth A had left Sherk House. Vice President of
Treatment Programs stated notifications were not made as
multiple staff were focused on finding Youth A in the snowing
conditions and the notifications were overlooked.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as they did not notify law
enforcement, the parent/legal guardian, the referring agency or
the licensing authority.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
